verses.roman:
taṁ tu saṅkarṣaṇo mūrdhni
patantam acalo yathā
pratijagrāha balavān
sunandenāhanac ca tam

synonyms: tam—that (tree trunk); tu—but; saṅkarṣaṇaḥ—Lord Balarāma; mūrdhni—on His head; patantam—falling; acalaḥ—an unmoving mountain; yathā—like; pratijagrāha—took hold of; bala-vān—powerful; sunandena—with Sunanda, His club; ahanat—He struck; ca—and; tam—him, Dvivida.
translation: But Lord Saṅkarṣaṇa remained as motionless as a mountain and simply grabbed the log as it fell upon His head. He then struck Dvivida with His club, named Sunanda.
